title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3213/92 of 4 November 1992 fixing the intervention thresholds for oranges, mandarins, satsumas and clementines for the 1992/93 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 3213/92  of 4 November 1992  fixing the intervention thresholds for oranges, mandarins, satsumas and clementines for the 1992/93 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The intervention thresholds for oranges, mandarins, satsumas and clementines for the 1992/93 marketing year shall be as follows:
- oranges: 1 179 400 tonnes
- mandarins: 33 900 tonnes
- satsumas: 35 800 tonnes
- clementines: 112 900 tonnes.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 4 November 1992. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 118, 20. 5. 1972, p. 1. (2) OJ No L 180, 1. 7. 1992, p. 23. (3) OJ No L 198, 26. 7. 1988, p. 9. (4) OJ No L 150, 15. 6. 1991, p. 8. (5) OJ No L 118, 29. 4. 1989, p. 25. (6) OJ No L 324, 27. 12. 1969, p. 21. (7) OJ No L 374, 22. 12.  1989, p. 6.
